page.title: 11Wimbledon Common (4)Environs
page.content: The southeast side is boarded by a particularly pleasant area to live in with wide roads and expensive detached houses with walled gardens, a few with swimming pools. The owners walk their dogs on the Commons and ride horses on the cinder track and horse rides which criss cross it. Cyclists and walkers enjoy the paths. Heavy traffic during Wimbledon Fortnight at the All England Tennis Club makes the roads very busy. To the northeast there is an estate of high rise flats owned by Wandsworth Borough Coucil. There are very few local facilities. In Calonne Road there is a Buddhapadisa Temple built 2 years ago in the grounds of a large house. Buddhist monks can be seen in deep saffron robes with their heads shaved. Visitors are made very welcome. There are no fences round the Common. Text pages by Roehampton Church School.
